abstract: Elouise Cobell, heroine to American Indians for leading 15-year legal battle over federal mismanagement of Indian trust funds, dies at age 65.
snippet: A $3.4 billion settlement was reached after Ms. Cobell, as the lead plaintiff, filed a lawsuit alleging federal mismanagement of Indian trust funds since the late 1800s.
lead_paragraph: A $3.4 billion settlement was reached after Ms. Cobell, as the lead plaintiff, filed a lawsuit alleging federal mismanagement of Indian trust funds since the late 1800s.

headline.main: Elouise Cobell, 65, Dies; Sued U.S. Over Indian Trust Funds
headline.print_headline: Elouise Cobell, 65; Sued for Indian Funds
headline.seo: Elouise Cobell, 65, Dies; Sued U.S. Over Indian Trust Funds
